Hello This is webpack info to create bundel of application.

Steps To Start (basics)

1. In package.json create a build script of webpack and run command npm run build. it will create main.js in dist

2. Add this file in script tag of html file

3. Create a js file in src and add some function to it

4. Import it to index and call function

5. Now delete build and type command npm run build. it will create minified version of all files in main.js

6. Now run the app on browser and check console. You have created webpack bundle appliction which is minified version of application.

Steps to create webpack config

1. Create Webpack config in root folder

2. Add configs to module.export.

3. Set 'mode' option to 'development' or 'production' to enable defaults for each environment.

4. Not delete main.js and create another build. now you will see the changes in file of main.js.

Steps to create entry and output for webpack

1. Delete old build file from dist main.js

2. For Understanding remain index file to App.js

3. In webpack.config.js create to key entry and output keys.

4. Entry point : provide app.js path in entry key. now this file will be your entry point for app

5. Output point :
1. Import path package from node to get path of your files.
2. Create object for output and provide path where we want to create minified buldel of application and provide file name for it.
3. Now replace this file details in script file with main.js

Now to run minified app you need to delete the old build and again create new build which is very tideous task so now we will automeate the process.

Steps to create minified version on every changes done in application. Automating build

1. Install webpack-dev-server

2. Create start script in package json "webpack-dev-server --mode development --open"

3. In webpack config add devServer key and asign bject which contain the folder name using path.join and add port number

4. use command npm start. your dev server will be stared with webpack try to change function it will use HMR to reload changes.

Now we will connect this project to host and try to load some content on host

1. Create the host project and follow all above steps to create and project with web pack config

2. Install html-webpack-plugin using npm in both project

3. In Project 1
1. create content.js file with content to load in host.
2. Import that file in App.js and create project1Content variable using window to use content globally and asign imported content.
3. In webpack config import HtmlWebpackPlugin. create plugin key in modules and in array provide templete file path.
4. Apply cors header in devServer object so that when ever we make changes in project1 content it reflect in host immidetly.
5. Now module rules that will allow injecting other extension fine in webpack.

4. In Host app
1. Create load content function that will load our content in html div.
2. In load content create a script tag element using dom and provide src of our build file from project1 eg. http://localhost:[project1-port-number]/[your-bundel-fileProject1].js apend it in div.
3. In webpack config import HtmlWebpackPlugin. create plugin key in modules and in array provide templete file path.
4. Now module rules that will allow injecting other extension fine in webpack.

5. Now start both project and see magic

If any difficulty while following above steps please follow the commit of repo and go through code base.
